channel.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] How to make Setup Packages for your applications!
channel.description:
Its Soo Easy. But i will provide a very detailed tutorial on it ;)
[b] Step One:[/b] "Start" > All Programs > Microsoft Visual-Studio 6.0 > Tools > Package and Deployment.
[b]Step Two:[/b] Click the "Package" Button and a new menu should come up. [URL=http://img257.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screeen1bs4.png][IMG]http://img257.imageshack.us/img257/7082/screeen1bs4.png[/img][/URL]
It will ask you to find the [i].vbp[/i] (Visual Basic Project File) when you have found it it will ask to find the [i].exe[/i]. If you cant find it Do not worry. it will ask if you would like to complie it into another exe :)
[b]Step Three[/b] Now it will ask you a bunch of crap. just keep pressing ok, ok ,ok.
When you have finished the setup go to the folder were you saved it:
[URL=http://img257.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screeen2mp6.png][IMG]http://img257.imageshack.us/img257/3551/screeen2mp6.png[/img][/URL]
Now there should be about 3 Files (or more) and a folder:[URL=http://img257.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screeen3bw5.png][IMG]http://img257.imageshack.us/img257/2788/screeen3bw5.th.png[/img][/URL][/b]
[b]Step Four[/b] When you get them files Zip them.
Right Click > New Archive > Drag all of the files to the archive.
[b]Step Five[/b] Now you can share these files and if all goes well your app has a setup file ;)
Its good to make some Mirrors as some people do not like some of the downloads.
www.rapidshare.com www.megaupload.com
If you like this tut please sign up to my Programming Forum at: www.lagex.net/forums
Thanks!!!!
~wonderguy6!

item.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] How to make Setup Packages for your applications!
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“mvp566, post:3, topic:58717”][quote author=deathader link=topic=84105.msg904871#msg904871 date=1171592395]
nice tut. But i don’t realy see how this is useful… why don’t you just save the program as exe?
[/quote]

wouldent be much of a difference but this adds it under program files and stuff…[/quote]
Yep. and people were asking around for how to make a setup file and yeh.

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] How to make Setup Packages for your applications!
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

Its Soo Easy. But i will provide a very detailed tutorial on it


Step One:
“Start” > All Programs > Microsoft Visual-Studio 6.0 > Tools > Package and Deployment.

Step Two:
Click the “Package” Button and a new menu should come up.

It will ask you to find the .vbp (Visual Basic Project File) when you have found it it will ask to find the .exe. If you cant find it Do not worry. it will ask if you would like to complie it into another exe

Step Three
Now it will ask you a bunch of crap. just keep pressing ok, ok ,ok.

When you have finished the setup go to the folder were you saved it:

Now there should be about 3 Files (or more) and a folder:[/b]

Step Four
When you get them files Zip them.

Right Click > New Archive > Drag all of the files to the archive.

Step Five
Now you can share these files and if all goes well your app has a setup file

Its good to make some Mirrors as some people do not like some of the downloads.

www.rapidshare.com
www.megaupload.com

If you like this tut please sign up to my Programming Forum at: www.lagex.net/forums

Thanks!!!

~wonderguy6!

Read full topic
